posts.html:
Rapid produce an exciting and disruptive low‐code platform which we use to create desktop, mobile, and forms apps to help local authorities improve their services, especially in social housing. Based just North of London in Welwyn Hatfield we are a small and growing company, able to offer friendly and supportive working arrangements. Our customers are great, and the work is varied and never dull!

Empowering Government and Industry Through Specialised Solutions.

At Rapid, we are dedicated to fuelling the progress of both government and industry through our specialised software solutions. These solutions are the driving force behind enhanced performance, heightened productivity, and an improved overall experience for all stakeholders involved.

Our commitment to excellence is evident in the meticulous approach we take. Our solutions are built around the user, with every facet crafted to cater to their specific needs. In our pursuit of perfection, we collaborate closely with industry experts who possess an in-depth understanding of every nuance of each process. This collaborative effort ensures that every detail is accounted for, resulting in software solutions that are both robust and intuitive.

Central to our approach are our hard-working process engines that lie at the core of our software solutions. These engines go beyond the ordinary to deliver exceptional functionality. By embedding workflows that drive efficiency and adhere to best practices, we transform complex operations into streamlined processes. Automation of tasks, simplification of intricate procedures, and the mastery of information management are our hallmarks.

At Rapid, we comprehend the transformative power of digital technology. Through our solutions, we enable you to harness this power effectively. Our offerings are designed to empower you to do more – whether it's automating tasks, simplifying complexities, or managing information more efficiently. Our goal is to ensure that you can fully leverage the potential of the digital era.

Based just North of London in Welwyn Hatfield we are a small and growing company, able to offer friendly and supportive working arrangements. Our customers are great, and the work is varied and never dull!

At Rapid, we are dedicated to fuelling the progress of both government and industry through our specialised software solutions. These solutions are the driving force behind enhanced performance, heightened productivity, and an improved overall experience for all stakeholders involved.

Our commitment to excellence is evident in the meticulous approach we take. Our solutions are built around the user, with every facet crafted to cater to their specific needs. In our pursuit of perfection, we collaborate closely with industry experts who possess an in-depth understanding of every nuance of each process. This collaborative effort ensures that every detail is accounted for, resulting in software solutions that are both robust and intuitive.

Central to our approach are our hard-working process engines that lie at the core of our software solutions. These engines go beyond the ordinary to deliver exceptional functionality. By embedding workflows that drive efficiency and adhere to best practices, we transform complex operations into streamlined processes. Automation of tasks, simplification of intricate procedures, and the mastery of information management are our hallmarks.

At Rapid, we comprehend the transformative power of digital technology. Through our solutions, we enable you to harness this power effectively. Our offerings are designed to empower you to do more – whether it's automating tasks, simplifying complexities, or managing information more efficiently. Our goal is to ensure that you can fully leverage the potential of the digital era.

posts.html:
Rapid Education & Welfare: Empowering Education, School Management, and Welfare Support.

We provide a comprehensive software solution that goes beyond standard education and school management functionalities. Our platform includes a powerful Welfare Rights Referral module, enabling seamless coordination of services and specialised welfare rights advice to council tenants. With a focus on sustaining tenancies, accessing benefits entitlement, and avoiding rent arrears, our software empowers individuals to achieve financial stability and maintain stable housing situations.

We provide a comprehensive software solution that goes beyond standard education and school management functionalities. Our platform includes a powerful Welfare Rights Referral module, enabling seamless coordination of services and specialised welfare rights advice to council tenants. With a focus on sustaining tenancies, accessing benefits entitlement, and avoiding rent arrears, our software empowers individuals to achieve financial stability and maintain stable housing situations.

posts.html:
Simplify and streamline property compliance processes with our comprehensive solutions. With a range of powerful features, our software empowers property managers, inspectors, and safety professionals to ensure compliance with regulations, mitigate risks, and prioritise the well-being of residents. From asbestos management to fire safety inspections and health and safety monitoring, our software covers all essential compliance areas.

Fire Safety Inspections

Efficiently perform mobile fire safety inspections with our Fire Safety module. Our software allows inspectors to conduct inspections on-site using mobile devices, streamlining the data collection process. Integration with other IT systems enables seamless transfer of inspection data and automatic integration of remedial actions. Stay on top of fire safety requirements and ensure compliance for enhanced resident safety.

Asbestos Management

Our software's Asbestos module allows you to efficiently record and track the presence of asbestos in properties. From initial assessments to ongoing monitoring and remedial actions, our solution provides a centralized database to manage asbestos-related information. Ensure the safety of residents and comply with regulations by effectively addressing and monitoring asbestos risks.

Health and Safety Monitoring

Our Health and Safety Monitoring module serves as a central hub for joining health and safety reports and remedial actions between different IT systems. This feature streamlines the coordination and tracking of health and safety measures, ensuring comprehensive monitoring and timely resolution of issues. Seamlessly integrate data from various sources to achieve a holistic view of compliance and enhance safety practices.

posts.html:
Our Billing System simplifies the production of tenant and leaseholder bills, ensuring transparency and accuracy in billing calculations.

With the ability to import and transform costs from various sources, including services and contractors, you can easily apply calculation and apportionment rules using data from the housing management system or any other system.

Generate personalised bills using meter readings, apply scales, uplifts, caps, debt reduction, VAT, and other calculations to reflect residents' consumption accurately. This transparency increases resident satisfaction and lowers administration costs while ensuring all costs are recovered.

He has worked with leading local authority housing departments and housing associations since 2005 and created the UK’s first online housing application form with instant assessment and full change of circumstances for the London Borough of Camden in 2007."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In 2015, Gareth created Rapid, a tool that makes it easy for anyone to create and integrate software for mobile, desktop, forms, and APIs, without code. He now leads a team of enthusiastic developers that use Rapid, and their knowledge of housing, to integrate and join up legacy IT systems, and create apps that improve customer experience and help housing services be more efficient."]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
Gareth is the Founder and Head of Development at Rapid Information Systems. He is passionate about open-source software and reducing the cost of technology for the public sector. He has worked with leading local authority housing departments and housing associations since 2005 and created the UK’s first online housing application form with instant assessment and full change of circumstances for the London Borough of Camden in 2007.

In 2015, Gareth created Rapid, a tool that makes it easy for anyone to create and integrate software for mobile, desktop, forms, and APIs, without code. He now leads a team of enthusiastic developers that use Rapid, and their knowledge of housing, to integrate and join up legacy IT systems, and create apps that improve customer experience and help housing services be more efficient.
posts.plaintext:
Gareth is the Founder and Head of Development at Rapid Information Systems. He is passionate about open-source software and reducing the cost of technology for the public sector. He has worked with leading local authority housing departments and housing associations since 2005 and created the UK’s first online housing application form with instant assessment and full change of circumstances for the London Borough of Camden in 2007.

In 2015, Gareth created Rapid, a tool that makes it easy for anyone to create and integrate software for mobile, desktop, forms, and APIs, without code. He now leads a team of enthusiastic developers that use Rapid, and their knowledge of housing, to integrate and join up legacy IT systems, and create apps that improve customer experience and help housing services be more efficient.

posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Dagney has 9 years experience in the IT industry. Her work experience has afforded her a diverse skill set – a ‘Jack of all trades’ if you will. She has worked as a back end developer (Java and databases), DevOps engineer (Linux, Docker, AWS) and most recently front end developer which is now her preferred role. When I am out of full time work she likes to tutor maths and physics."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"She completed undergrad at the University of Aberdeen (UK) and commenced my Masters in Digital Forensics at the University of Pretoria (SA)."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Her non-technical strengths typically lie in her communication skills and the fact that she loves to work in a team (rather than go solo), and enjoys the people aspect of the workplace immensely."]]]],"ghostVersion":"4.0"}
posts.html:
Dagney has 9 years experience in the IT industry. Her work experience has afforded her a diverse skill set – a ‘Jack of all trades’ if you will. She has worked as a back end developer (Java and databases), DevOps engineer (Linux, Docker, AWS) and most recently front end developer which is now her preferred role. When I am out of full time work she likes to tutor maths and physics.

She completed undergrad at the University of Aberdeen (UK) and commenced my Masters in Digital Forensics at the University of Pretoria (SA).

Her non-technical strengths typically lie in her communication skills and the fact that she loves to work in a team (rather than go solo), and enjoys the people aspect of the workplace immensely.
posts.plaintext:
Dagney has 9 years experience in the IT industry. Her work experience has afforded her a diverse skill set – a ‘Jack of all trades’ if you will. She has worked as a back end developer (Java and databases), DevOps engineer (Linux, Docker, AWS) and most recently front end developer which is now her preferred role. When I am out of full time work she likes to tutor maths and physics.

She completed undergrad at the University of Aberdeen (UK) and commenced my Masters in Digital Forensics at the University of Pretoria (SA).

Her non-technical strengths typically lie in her communication skills and the fact that she loves to work in a team (rather than go solo), and enjoys the people aspect of the workplace immensely.

posts.html:
Jozef graduated with a BSc in Computer Science from the University of Portsmouth, specialising in Machine Learning and Interface Design. He has a fascination for the physics of both, and the interaction between UI and psychology.

He is always excited by the innovation in new technologies and wants to see every product progress in power and accessibility.

He is always excited by the innovation in new technologies and wants to see every product progress in power and accessibility.

posts.html:
Our people are the foundation of our business and why we’re a trusted software provider by housing providers and contractors. Our people are the reason we’re able to provide you with award-winning field service software, support and services.

Everyone in our business embodies our core values:

Expertise. Through our internal team of technical experts and network of specialist partners, we’ve built collective expertise to equip you with the tools and knowledge your organisation needs to improve.

Innovate. We believe that achieving success requires Everyday Evolution. That’s why our people are curious and ambitious. Constantly seeking new solutions to support our client partners and the changing challenges they face.

Empower. By empowering everyone in our organisation to achieve their full potential, we are able to deliver award-winning job management software that empowers our client partners to take control of their data and identify service delivery improvements.

Unity. By working together – both internally and with our client partners – we are greater than the sum of our parts. As a unit, we can achieve more.
posts.plaintext:
Our people are the foundation of our business and why we’re a trusted software provider by housing providers and contractors. Our people are the reason we’re able to provide you with award-winning field service software, support and services.

Everyone in our business embodies our core values:

Expertise. Through our internal team of technical experts and network of specialist partners, we’ve built collective expertise to equip you with the tools and knowledge your organisation needs to improve.

Innovate. We believe that achieving success requires Everyday Evolution. That’s why our people are curious and ambitious. Constantly seeking new solutions to support our client partners and the changing challenges they face.

Empower. By empowering everyone in our organisation to achieve their full potential, we are able to deliver award-winning job management software that empowers our client partners to take control of their data and identify service delivery improvements.

Unity. By working together – both internally and with our client partners – we are greater than the sum of our parts. As a unit, we can achieve more.

posts.html:
We exist to deliver software that contributes to improving the lives of people in social housing across the UK. It's as simple as that.

We work closely with housing associations and social landlords to increase tenant satisfaction and improve service delivery in what is perhaps one of the most critical and emotive services you offer – repairs and maintenance.

We also specialise in working with contractors and subcontractors to help increase first-time fix rates and reduce no-access appointments.

Ultimately, everything we do is focused directly on improving the lives of people in social housing. Our software exists to positively impact your organisation and support you in improving your service delivery to tenants. And that is something we are extremely passionate about.

We also specialise in working with contractors and subcontractors to help increase first-time fix rates and reduce no-access appointments.

Ultimately, everything we do is focused directly on improving the lives of people in social housing. Our software exists to positively impact your organisation and support you in improving your service delivery to tenants. And that is something we are extremely passionate about.

posts.html:
Our promise is to deliver a constantly beneficial partnership for our clients which means Rapid is the last service management software you need to invest in.

Trusted for over a decade by the housing community, we provide solutions that help social housing providers and contractors deliver the positive repairs and maintenance service that their tenants deserve and providers need.

You're more likely to find us talking to residents or out with operatives than you are in exhibitions because for us, serving the housing sector isn’t just a job, it's a purpose. This is why we invest heavily in understanding the needs, requirements and frustrations of the consumers that we and our clients serve. This ensures that we are always focussed on delivering functionality when and where it needs to be delivered, addressing both client and consumer requirements; increasing efficiency, evidencing compliance and providing a leading customer experience.

We understand that the challenges you face are constantly evolving and so is our software. We strongly believe that to be successful requires Everyday Evolution and that’s why we’re dedicated to continuously developing and deploying our software, to help you meet the challenges of today and tomorrow head-on.

We've created an intelligent job management system for services companies that is powerful, easy to use, simple to configure and quick to implement. Rapid enables you to seamlessly connect your office teams, field operatives, and customers while reducing administration, paperwork and associated costs.

As self-sufficiency without the fear of incurring additional costs is a big priority for many of our clients, part of our promise is to deliver genuine ongoing support and training that empowers your team to administrate Oneserve and configure components as and when you need to.
posts.plaintext:
Our promise is to deliver a constantly beneficial partnership for our clients which means Rapid is the last service management software you need to invest in.

Trusted for over a decade by the housing community, we provide solutions that help social housing providers and contractors deliver the positive repairs and maintenance service that their tenants deserve and providers need.

You're more likely to find us talking to residents or out with operatives than you are in exhibitions because for us, serving the housing sector isn’t just a job, it's a purpose. This is why we invest heavily in understanding the needs, requirements and frustrations of the consumers that we and our clients serve. This ensures that we are always focussed on delivering functionality when and where it needs to be delivered, addressing both client and consumer requirements; increasing efficiency, evidencing compliance and providing a leading customer experience.

We understand that the challenges you face are constantly evolving and so is our software. We strongly believe that to be successful requires Everyday Evolution and that’s why we’re dedicated to continuously developing and deploying our software, to help you meet the challenges of today and tomorrow head-on.

We've created an intelligent job management system for services companies that is powerful, easy to use, simple to configure and quick to implement. Rapid enables you to seamlessly connect your office teams, field operatives, and customers while reducing administration, paperwork and associated costs.

As self-sufficiency without the fear of incurring additional costs is a big priority for many of our clients, part of our promise is to deliver genuine ongoing support and training that empowers your team to administrate Oneserve and configure components as and when you need to.

posts.html:
At Rapid we believe public sector organisations should make the most of their legacy IT investments, progress can be made via integrations into more modern systems without necessarily involving a big change.

The majority of Rapid implementations involve interfaces with 3rd party systems and we has a set of established APIs to facilitate this that are used by both customers and the company.

Our team of skilled professionals have extensive experience at specifying and delivering working interfaces to 3rd party systems. This includes Housing management system (HMS), Property management system (PMS), Document management system (DMS), Content management system (CMS), Customer relationship management (CRM), Learning management system (LMS), Financial management system (FMS), and Enterprise resource planning (ERP), to name just a few.

We are particularly skilled at keeping multiple systems up to date with Rapid being available as a Dashboard providing management and stakeholders with a near real time status overview.

posts.html:
Buying frameworks – what are they and how do they work?

Procuring technology and services can be a complex and lengthy undertaking, often involving significant time, cost and resource. Buying frameworks are designed to simplify that process, enabling public sector organisations to procure services from pre-approved suppliers that are accredited and meet all of the expected standards and requirements.

With standardised contract terms compliant with public sector procurement regulations, buyers have peace of mind that they are partnering with a supplier that has been fully vetted and is capable of delivering the requirements.

Buyers have the option of running a mini-competition, or in many cases can direct award (‘call off’) when required, which is often the fastest way to procure services via a framework. Direct award means you can partner directly with the supplier that best suits the needs of your business and avoids the high cost, time and resource demanded by the traditional procurement process.

With a strong heritage as a trusted government partner, Rapid has the knowledge and experience of working with public sector frameworks and guiding buyers through the process. We understand the challenges and constraints uniquely faced by public sector organisations and with our expertise and market experience, we can help you in navigating the framework process to ensure a seamless, efficient and cost-effective outcome.

Get in touch

Key benefits

Simple and straightforward

Buying frameworks provide public sector organisations with a simple and trusted method to procure services that support their specific business needs.

Peace of mind

Suppliers must be fully accredited and pre-approved to list on government buying frameworks. Additionally, supplier contracts include performance management to ensure value and service continually evolves.

Robust frameworks

With standardised contract terms and conditions that comply with UK/EU procurement legislation, buyers can rest assured when it comes to due diligence.

Quick and efficient

With a straightforward and standardised process, buying frameworks can significantly reduce the procurement timescale, as well as the costs and resources involved compared to other procurement methods.

Market expertise

As experts in the market, Rapid is ideally placed to support your business through the procurement process, including navigating direct award and advice on contracting from our in-house legal counsel.

Framework agreements

G-Cloud 13 (RM1557.13)

G-Cloud 13 is the latest iteration of a government framework designed to make the process of procuring cloud hosting, software and support services cost-effective.

Learn more

Digital Outcomes 6 (RM1043.8)

The Digital Outcomes 6 framework supports the public sector in purchasing bespoke digital solutions and services, replacing Digital Outcomes and Specialists 5.

Learn more

posts.html:
Rapid Information Systems is committed to preventing modern slavery and human trafficking in our operations and supply chain. We strive to uphold ethical business practices and to ensure that our employees, suppliers, and partners are treated with respect and dignity.

Our policy

We have a zero-tolerance policy towards modern slavery and human trafficking. We believe in treating all individuals with fairness, respect, and dignity, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, or any other characteristic. We expect the same from all our suppliers and partners, and we hold them accountable for adhering to our ethical standards.

Our approach

We have taken the following steps to prevent modern slavery and human trafficking in our operations and supply chain:

  • We conduct thorough due diligence on all new suppliers and partners, including their ethical and social responsibility practices.
  • We have implemented a system of risk assessment and management to identify and mitigate potential risks of modern slavery and human trafficking in our operations and supply chain.
  • We provide training and resources to our employees to raise awareness of modern slavery and human trafficking and to help them identify and report any potential issues,
  • We have a whistleblowing policy that allows employees, suppliers, and partners to report any concerns they may have about modern slavery and human trafficking, and we take all such reports seriously and investigate them thoroughly.
  • We regularly review and update our policies and procedures to ensure that they remain effective in preventing modern slavery and human trafficking.

Our Commitment

We are committed to working towards a world free of modern slavery and human trafficking. We will continue to uphold our ethical standards, conduct due diligence on our suppliers and partners, and provide training and resources to our employees to help prevent and mitigate the risk of modern slavery and human trafficking in our operations and supply chain.

This Statement is made in accordance with Section 54(1) of the Modern Slavery Act 2015 and constitutes Three’s Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking Statement for the financial year commencing 1 June 2021 and ending 31 May 2022.

Signed by,

Kumar Modi, Director, Rapid Information Systems Limited.

posts.html:
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (Regulation (EU) 2016/679) is a privacy and data protection regulation in the European Union (EU) and has been enforced since May 25 2018 and requires no enabling legislation so automatically becomes binding and applicable on that date.

The GDPR imposes new obligations on organisations that control or process relevant personal data and introduces new rights and protections for EU data subjects.

The GDPR applies to data processing carried out by organisations operating within the EU. It also applies to organisations outside the EU that offer goods or services to individuals in the EU.

Rapid Information Systems places a high importance on information security and within our Group we are already implementing a number of standards that also focus on information data security including IS27001, and Cyber Essentials.

Rapid Information Systems are:

  • Processors for our hosted client data
  • Controllers of our client and supplier contact information, required to; manage & deliver services under contract; manage customer requests & incidents
  • Controllers for personnel information in relation to Six Degree Group companies employees

Our GDPR principles

  • We will process all personal data fairly and lawfully
  • We will only process personal data for specified and lawful purposes
  • We will endeavour to hold relevant and accurate personal data, and where practical, we will keep it up to date
  • We will not keep personal data for longer than is necessary
  • We will keep all personal data secure
  • We will ensure that personal data remains within the European Economic Area (EEA)

Our approach

During our journey to GDPR compliance Rapid Information Systems has been and is continuing to work very closely with an external adviser to ensure we have the expertise required to implement the legislation requirements accurately and comprehensively.

We view GDPR as a constant programme of works that will require continuous monitoring, management and improvement.

Work streams and actions taken

The table below shows the main activities to ensure compliance:

Requirements Activity
Data Impact Assessments & Data Inventory We have undertaken a review of the data we store, manage, maintain, collect,process and control. This includes offline storage and paper records. Assessments of the data will review information flow, any data transfers, risk reviews, and structural position in relation to Lawfulness, Purpose, Minimisation, Accuracy, Consent, Limitation, Integrity & Confidentiality, Record Keeping and Accountability.
Website Data Collection & Consent, Privacy Notice The Rapid Information Systems privacy notice has been updated to cover the new GDPR requirement on individuals
GDPR training and awareness Internal staff briefings and training have been carried out and senior management are aware of their corporate responsibilities.
Supplier & Partner relationships These are under review to ensure GDPR compliance is satisfactory from our third parties. Where required, GDPR supplier agreements are being completed to ensure that our third party and suppliers are complying with the GDPR.
Technology reviews We are reviewing our technology platforms to analyse their operation, security, compliance in order to ensure that they meet the standards we have laid down and identify any gaps and risks.
Privacy by Design This now forms a compulsory consideration for all technical design alongside ‘security by design’.
DPO appointment We have nominated a DPO within Rapid Information Systems. They can be contacted at gdpr@rapid-is.co.uk

The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (Regulation (EU) 2016/679) is a privacy and data protection regulation in the European Union (EU) and has been enforced since May 25 2018 and requires no enabling legislation so automatically becomes binding and applicable on that date.

The GDPR imposes new obligations on organisations that control or process relevant personal data and introduces new rights and protections for EU data subjects.

The GDPR applies to data processing carried out by organisations operating within the EU. It also applies to organisations outside the EU that offer goods or services to individuals in the EU.

Rapid Information Systems places a high importance on information security and within our Group we are already implementing a number of standards that also focus on information data security including IS27001, and Cyber Essentials.


Rapid Information Systems are:

 * Processors for our hosted client data
 * Controllers of our client and supplier contact information, required to; manage & deliver services under contract; manage customer requests & incidents
 * Controllers for personnel information in relation to Six Degree Group companies employees


Our GDPR principles

 * We will process all personal data fairly and lawfully
 * We will only process personal data for specified and lawful purposes
 * We will endeavour to hold relevant and accurate personal data, and where practical, we will keep it up to date
 * We will not keep personal data for longer than is necessary
 * We will keep all personal data secure
 * We will ensure that personal data remains within the European Economic Area (EEA)


Our approach

During our journey to GDPR compliance Rapid Information Systems has been and is continuing to work very closely with an external adviser to ensure we have the expertise required to implement the legislation requirements accurately and comprehensively.

We view GDPR as a constant programme of works that will require continuous monitoring, management and improvement.


Work streams and actions taken

The table below shows the main activities to ensure compliance:




Requirements
Activity




Data Impact Assessments & Data Inventory
We have undertaken a review of the data we store, manage, maintain, collect,process and control.
This includes offline storage and paper records. Assessments of the data will review information
flow, any data transfers, risk reviews, and structural position in relation to Lawfulness, Purpose,
Minimisation, Accuracy, Consent, Limitation, Integrity & Confidentiality, Record Keeping and
Accountability.


Website Data Collection & Consent, Privacy Notice
The Rapid Information Systems privacy notice has been updated to cover the new GDPR requirement on
individuals


GDPR training and awareness
Internal staff briefings and training have been carried out and senior management are aware of their
corporate responsibilities.


Supplier & Partner relationships
These are under review to ensure GDPR compliance is satisfactory from our third parties. Where
required, GDPR supplier agreements are being completed to ensure that our third party and suppliers
are complying with the GDPR.


Technology reviews
We are reviewing our technology platforms to analyse their operation, security, compliance in order
to ensure that they meet the standards we have laid down and identify any gaps and risks.


Privacy by Design
This now forms a compulsory consideration for all technical design alongside ‘security by design’.



DPO appointment
We have nominated a DPO within Rapid Information Systems. They can be contacted at
gdpr@rapid-is.co.uk

posts.html:
Rapid Information Systems Ltd ("us", "we", or "our") uses cookies on www.rapid-is.co.uk (the "Service"). By using the Service, you consent to the use of cookies.

Our cookie policy explains what cookies are, how we use cookies, how third-parties we may partner with may use cookies on the Service, your choices regarding cookies and further information about cookies.

What are cookies

Cookies are small pieces of text sent by your web browser by a website you visit. A cookie file is stored in your web browser and allows the Service or a third-party to recognize you and make your next visit easier and the Service more useful to you.

Cookies can be "persistent" or "session" cookies.

How Rapid Information Systems Ltd uses cookies

When you use and access the Service, we may place a number of cookies files in your web browser.

We use cookies for the following purposes: to enable certain functions of the Service, to provide analytics, to store your preferences, to enable advertisements delivery, including behavioral advertising.

We use both session and persistent cookies on the Service and we use different types of cookies to run the Service:

  • Essential cookies
    We may use essential cookies to authenticate users and prevent fraudulent use of user accounts.
  • Third-party cookies
    In addition to our own cookies, we may also use various third-parties cookies to report usage statistics of the Service, deliver advertisements on and through the Service, and so on.

What are your choices regarding cookies

If you'd like to delete cookies or instruct your web browser to delete or refuse cookies, please visit the help pages of your web browser.

Please note, however, that if you delete cookies or refuse to accept them, you might not be able to use all of the features we offer, you may not be able to store your preferences, and some of our pages might not display properly.

Where can your find more information about cookies

You can learn more about cookies and the following third-party websites:

  • What Are Internet Cookies and How Are They Used? -  All About Cookies
